Sportsmen club with indoor archery, air rifle range, outdoor archery, and 3D course. Founded in 1930, facilities accommodate up to 250 people. Archery instruction available.

column16: Indoor archery club located at Columbus Club. Affiliated with Golden Feather Archery Club of Aylmer. Hosts tri-county indoor archery championships and other competitive events.

column16: NOTE: No standalone 'Bancroft Archery Club' exists. Archery facilities available through Bancroft Fish and Game Protective Association. column16: Professional archery shop and outdoor range located in Utopia (near Barrie). Features practice range with targets from 20-100 yards, 3D target walking trail with foam targets including bears, deer, moose, dinosaurs, and a 7-foot Sasquatch. Open to public as guest or member. Facilities include catch and release bass ponds, axe/knife throwing, horseshoe pits, BBQs and pavilion. Dawn to dusk access.
column17: archery, 3D archery, outdoor archery, archery range, pro shop, Barrie, Utopia

column16: Premier multi-discipline sport shooting club serving Simcoe County, Barrie, Orillia, GTA and surrounding areas. Membership-based facility offering 10-position indoor range with 25-meter lanes and 24/7 access. Features outdoor archery range with full 3D target course winding through property. Additional facilities include 8 outdoor rifle/pistol/shotgun ranges from 5-150 meters, clay fields with American Skeet and Trap, and covered 5-stand course. Family-friendly, member-run club emphasizing safety. Junior programs available for air rifle, skeet, and archery. Clubhouse features washroom facilities, fireplace, classroom, meeting areas, ammunition and merchandise sales. Office hours: Sat 9am-1pm, Sun 10am-1pm, Mon-Tue 5pm-8pm. Closed on long weekends.
column17: archery, indoor range, 3D course, outdoor range, shooting club, membership
column18: Office: Sat 9am-1pm, Sun 10am-1pm, Mon-Tue 5pm-8pm. Indoor range: 24/7 for members. Closed on long weekends.

column16: Durham Region's premier multi-discipline shooting facility, located short drive from downtown Oshawa and within 60 minutes from Toronto. Member-only club with no walk-ins accepted. Features indoor archery range at 20 yards for members. Additional facilities include 3 trap fields, 5 skeet fields (4 American, 1 International Olympic), heated indoor 5-Stand facility, 18-station sporting clays course, rifle range (50-300 yards), and handgun range (25-50 yards). Club promotes safe, family-friendly environment. Office hours: Sun & Sat 9am-4pm. Main gate locks at 4pm. Membership at full capacity, no waiting list maintained.
column17: archery, shooting club, trap, skeet, sporting clays, rifle range, membership
column18: Office: Sat-Sun 9am-4pm. Range: 9am-3pm daily. No rounds after 3:15pm (trap/skeet), 2:30pm (sporting clays). Gate locks at 4pm.

column16: Archery club in Belleville area featuring both indoor and outdoor archery facilities. Offers 3D archery course for realistic hunting practice and target shooting. Located in Corbyville near Belleville, serving the Bay of Quinte region. Club provides archery opportunities for members and archers of all skill levels. Traditional archery club atmosphere focused on the sport of archery.
column17: archery, 3D archery, indoor archery, outdoor archery, traditional archery, Ontario

column2: Base Borden Rod and Gun Club
column16: Military base rod and gun club located on CFB Borden with comprehensive archery facilities. Indoor range (10-30m, 2 galleries) available 24/7 for members. Outdoor range (10-50m) open daylight hours. 3D archery course features 35 targets, operational spring to fall (closed in winter). Membership required - multiple categories including single ($80), family ($130-170), and military rates. Archery Directors: Jay Merner and Rob Warner. Access requires base access or membership.
column17: archery, shooting, military, indoor range, outdoor range, 3D course, membership required
column18: Indoor: 24/7 for members, Outdoor: Daylight hours

column16: Pop-N-Jay archery club located at Bothwell Legion. Indoor archery facility shooting every Friday night at 7 p.m. Registered with Archery Ontario (Club Code: ON15). Active competition team, the Bothwell Robin Hood archers, who won the men's division in the National Pop N Jay Archery tournament. All skill levels welcome. Contact Martha Van Der Paelt for more information.
column17: archery, Pop-N-Jay, indoor archery, traditional archery, Ontario

column16: Peel Archery Club houses Ontario's only 70m indoor target range, making it a premiere training ground for beginners and olympians alike. The facility offers 24/7 member access, tailored lessons for all levels from introductory to high performance, target and 3D league nights, and air gun range. Flexible personalized approach ensures each archer receives attention needed to excel. Member-focused club with fundamental development programs (FunDev) extending 6-8 weeks for continued growth.
column17: archery, indoor archery, 70m range, Olympic training, target archery, lessons, leagues

column16: The Brant Rod & Gun Club features a multi-lane, varied distance archery range located in a forested area behind its fish hatchery. The range accommodates longbows, compound bows, and crossbows, making it accessible to a broad spectrum of archery enthusiasts. Members frequently use the range for recreational shooting and the club occasionally hosts events or lessons, such as opportunities to try revamped targets and different shooting styles. The facility is known for maintaining a natural environment that enhances the experience of outdoor archery practice. It welcomes new members and guests to come and enjoy the archery range as part of broader club activities.
column17: archery, traditional archery, outdoor archery, Brantford
column37: No dedicated club - See Brant Rod & Gun Club

column2: Brockville District Fish and Game Club
column16: The Brockville District Fish and Game Club is a well-established shooting sports facility supporting multiple disciplines including archery. The club offers archery facilities for crossbow, compound bow, and recurve shooting. Located on a spacious property, BDFGC provides members with access to outdoor archery ranges and welcomes both experienced archers and newcomers to the sport. The club is part of Ontario's shooting sports community and offers a family-friendly environment for recreational shooting.
column17: archery, outdoor archery, Brockville, shooting sports

column16: Range Burlington, home of the Burlington Rifle and Revolver Club, offers a comprehensive outdoor archery range open year-round, dawn to dusk. The facility features a 3-lane outdoor archery range with distances up to 40 meters and a high backstop. The club welcomes compound and recurve bows up to 70 lbs, as well as crossbows with special training. Range Burlington is registered as an affiliate club under Archery Ontario and offers archery-only memberships. Club bows are available, and NCCP trained coaches provide instruction for new archers. Supervised archery hours include Sunday mornings (weather permitting) with crossbow-specific times on the first Sunday of every month.

column16: Established 1956 archery club in Caledon Hills with indoor and outdoor facilities. Facilities include full kitchen, washrooms, observation deck, patio. Affiliated with Archery Ontario and Archery Canada. Hosts Canadian, Ontario and International Championships.

column15: Pop 'n' Jay archery club meeting at Hungarian Hall, 71 King Street, Delhi. Shoots every Saturday night 8pm-10:30pm from October to May. column15: Archery program operated by Dryden District Conservation Club Inc. (DDCC). Outdoor archery at club property: Mondays 5:30pm (spring to fall after snow melts). Indoor archery: Tuesdays 6:30-8pm at Dryden High School. Certified archery range. 100% affiliated with Ontario Federation of Anglers and Hunters (OFAH). $5 million liability insurance. Youth archery programs funded by OFAH ($10,000) and Dryden Rotary Foundation ($10,000). Equipment includes compound bows, traditional recurves, indigenous longbows, arrows, targets. Becoming best-in-class community archery facility.
